summary: This is a bi-weekly update report from the Criminal Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, compiled on August 2, 2019. It summarizes significant developments, upcoming trials, and investigations across various units, including a dedicated section on the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking and abuse of minors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of an investigation for sexually abusing dozens of minors over more than a decade. He was recently indicted on sex trafficking charges and arrested upon arrival from Paris.

persons.name: Mark Scott
persons.context: Former Locke Lorde partner charged with laundering hundreds of millions of dollars of OneCoin proceeds. His trial is scheduled for October 7, 2019.

persons.name: Harald Joachim von der Goltz
persons.context: U.S.-based taxpayer charged in the Panama Papers case for concealing assets and income from the IRS using offshore entities. He was extradited from the UK.

persons.name: Richard Gaffey
persons.context: Accountant charged alongside Harald von der Goltz in the Panama Papers case for involvement in concealing assets.

persons.name: Dirk Brauer
persons.context: A co-defendant in the Panama Papers case who was interviewed by U.S. and German authorities in Germany.

persons.name: Lisa Bershan
persons.context: Creator of Incredible Edibles, pleaded guilty to securities fraud in the Starship Snacks scheme but was later found to have lied to the government about participating in a new investor scheme.

persons.name: Barry Schwartz
persons.context: Husband of Lisa Bershan, pleaded guilty to securities fraud in the Starship Snacks scheme.

persons.name: Joel Margulies
persons.context: Individual charged in the Starship Snacks securities fraud scheme who is going to trial.

persons.name: Sean Stewart
persons.context: Former managing director at Perella Weinberg Partners whose conviction for insider tipping was reversed; the government intends to retry him.

persons.name: Robert Stewart
persons.context: Father of Sean Stewart, co-defendant in the insider tipping case.

persons.name: David Middendorf
persons.context: Former KPMG insider convicted for using confidential PCAOB inspection information.

persons.name: Jeff Wada
persons.context: Former KPMG insider convicted alongside David Middendorf.

persons.name: John Geraci
persons.context: Charged with investment fraud for lying to victims about their $2 million investment after learning his partner, Nicholas Mitsakos, had misappropriated funds.

persons.name: Nicholas Mitsakos
persons.context: Partner of John Geraci who pleaded guilty to his role in the investment fraud scheme after fabricating his trading performance.

persons.name: Christopher Collins
persons.context: U.S. Congressman indicted for insider trading alongside his son and future father-in-law.

persons.name: Cameron Collins
persons.context: Son of Congressman Christopher Collins, indicted for insider trading.

persons.name: Stephen Zarsky
persons.context: Future father-in-law of Cameron Collins, indicted for insider trading alongside the Collins family.

persons.name: Gary Tanner
persons.context: Convicted of honest-services wire fraud and money laundering in a bribery scheme involving Valeant Pharmaceuticals.

persons.name: Andrew Davenport
persons.context: Convicted alongside Gary Tanner in the Valeant bribery scheme.

persons.name: Cordell Fitts
persons.context: NYC Department of Homeless Services police officer facing civil rights trial for excessive force against a homeless patient.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Attorney charged with extortion; trial scheduled for November 2019.

persons.name: Antonio DiMarco
persons.context: Charged with wire fraud and aggravated identity theft in a scheme to defraud art galleries, including Sotheby's.

persons.name: Joakim Von Ditmar
persons.context: Co-defendant of Antonio DiMarco in the art fraud scheme; is actively proffering and expected to become a cooperator.

persons.name: Michael Jones
persons.context: Charged in connection with the overdose death of Diana Haikova; rejected a plea offer and is going to trial.

persons.name: Dante Cubangbang
persons.context: Doctor charged in the 'Dirty Doctor Takedown' for prescribing millions of oxycodone pills for cash; has proffered and will likely plead guilty.

persons.name: Gargan
persons.context: Nurse practitioner charged alongside Dante Cubangbang; has said he is going to trial.

connections.description: A former employee of Epstein, who was young and abused by him, has engaged in an initial proffer with prosecutors. She also scheduled 'massages' for him.
Married couple who were co-defendants in the Starship Snacks securities fraud scheme.
Co-conspirators in the Starship Snacks securities fraud scheme that raised approximately $2 million.
Father and son; Sean was convicted of tipping his father Robert with material nonpublic information.
Partners in a fraudulent investment fund; Mitsakos misappropriated victim funds and Geraci concealed this from investors.
Father and son indicted together for insider trading.
Future father-in-law and son-in-law, indicted together for insider trading.
Co-defendants convicted in a bribery scheme that defrauded Valeant Pharmaceuticals.
Co-defendants in an art fraud scheme; Von Ditmar is proffering and may cooperate against DiMarco.
Taxpayer and his accountant, charged together in the Panama Papers case for concealing assets.
Doctor and nurse practitioner charged together in the 'Dirty Doctor Takedown' for illegally prescribing oxycodone.

events.title: Epstein Indictment and Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on one count of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and one substantive count of sex trafficking. He was arrested upon arriving at Teterboro airport from Paris, France, and detained pending trial.

events.title: Expected Guilty Plea of Dr. Voudouris
events.description: Dr. Voudouris, one of the doctors charged in the Insys kickback case, was expected to plead guilty on August 2, 2019.

events.title: Scheduled Trial of Mark Scott
events.description: Trial scheduled for Mark Scott, charged with laundering hundreds of millions of dollars from the OneCoin scheme.

events.title: Scheduled Panama Papers Trial
events.description: Trial scheduled for Harald Joachim von der Goltz and Richard Gaffey in the Panama Papers case.

events.title: Interview of DMS Bank Managing Director
events.description: Prosecutors planned to interview the managing director of DMS Bank in the Cayman Islands on August 13-14, 2019, regarding accounts used to launder OneCoin proceeds.

events.title: Scheduled Insider Trading Trial of Collins et al.
events.description: Trial scheduled for Congressman Christopher Collins, his son Cameron Collins, and Stephen Zarsky on insider trading charges.

events.title: Scheduled Extortion Trial of Michael Avenatti
events.description: Trial scheduled for Michael Avenatti on extortion charges.

events.title: Overdose Death of Diana Haikova
events.description: Diana Haikova died of a heroin overdose at her Manhattan apartment. Michael Jones was identified as delivering the fatal dose.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein resolved a prior federal investigation in the Southern District of Florida with a Non-Prosecution Agreement that immunized him and alleged co-conspirators.

keyFacts: The SDNY is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein for sexually abusing dozens of minors over more than a decade, including minors transported to/from New York. He was recently indicted on sex trafficking charges.

The investigation has interviewed numerous additional victims since the indictment, several of whom will likely serve as witnesses, and has engaged with counsel for several of Epstein's accomplices and/or employees.
Prosecutors conducted an initial proffer with a former Epstein employee who was herself abused by Epstein while scheduling 'massages' for him.

The report notes the 2008 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) that immunized Epstein and alleged co-conspirators, but the SDNY is proceeding because the NPA was binding only on the Southern District of Florida.

The document is a comprehensive internal update covering many other high-profile SDNY cases, including the Panama Papers, OneCoin money laundering, insider trading by Congressman Christopher Collins, and the Insys kickback case.
